original: kadalī pāṭitā yadvan niḥśeṣāvayavaiḥ saha /
analyzed: a kadalī pāṭitā yadvat niḥśeṣa avayavaiḥ saha
translated: Just as a plantain tree, when stripped of its layers, has nothing left,

original: na kiṃcit puruṣas tadvat pāṭitaḥ saha dhātubhiḥ // /
analyzed: na kiṃcid puruṣaḥ tadvat pāṭitaḥ saha dhātubhiḥ
translated: so a person, when dissected along with the elements, has no essence.

original: sarvadharmā anātmāna ity ato bhāṣitaṃ jinaiḥ /
analyzed: sarva dharmāḥ anātmānaḥ iti atas bhāṣitam jinaiḥ
translated: The Victors have said, All phenomena are without self,

original: dhātuṣaṭkaṃ ca taiḥ sarvaṃ nirṇītaṃ tac ca nārthataḥ // /
analyzed: dhātu ṣaṭkam ca taiḥ sarvam nirṇītam tat ca na arthataḥ
translated: but they have determined all six elements, and that is not the meaning.

original: naivam ātmā na cānātmā yāthābhūtyena labhyate /
analyzed: na evam ātmā na ca anātmā yāthābhūtyena labhyate
translated: The self is not found to exist or not to exist as it really is.

original: ātmānātmakṛtadṛṣṭī varvārāsmān mahāmuniḥ // /
analyzed: ātma anātma kṛtadṛṣṭī varvārā asmān mahā muniḥ
translated: The Great Sage has said that the views of self and non-self are like a magical creation.

original: dṛṣṭaśruṭādyaṃ muninā na satyaṃ na mṛṣoditaṃ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭa śruṭa ādyam muninā na satyam na mṛṣā uditam
translated: The Sage has said that what is seen, heard, etc. is neither true nor false.

original: pakṣāddhi pratipakṣaḥ syād ubhayaṃ tac ca nārthataḥ // /
analyzed: pakṣāt hi pratipakṣaḥ syāt ubhayam tat ca na arthataḥ
translated: For the antidote would be the opposite of the position, and both are not the meaning.

original: iti satyānṛtātīto loko 'yaṃ paramārthataḥ /
analyzed: iti satya anṛta atītaḥ lokaḥ yam paramārthataḥ
translated: Thus, this world is beyond truth and falsehood in the ultimate sense.

original: asmād eva ca tattvena nopaity asti ca nāsti ca // /
analyzed: asmāt eva ca tattvena na upaiti asti ca na asti ca
translated: And for this very reason, it is not apprehended as either existent or non-existent in reality.

original: yac caivaṃ sarvathā neti sarvajñas tat kathaṃ vadet /
analyzed: yat ca evam sarvathā na iti sarvajñaḥ tat katham vadet
translated: And how could the Omniscient One say that what is not in any way is thus?

original: sāntam ity athavānantaṃ dvayaṃ vādvayam eva vā // /
analyzed: sa antam iti athavā anantam dvayam vā advayam eva vā
translated: As finite, or infinite, or both, or neither.

original: asaṃkhyeyā gatā buddhās tathaiṣyanty atha sāṃpratāḥ /
analyzed: asaṃkhyeyāḥ gatāḥ buddhāḥ tathā eṣyanti atha sāṃpratāḥ
translated: Innumerable Buddhas have passed away, and so will come in the future, and now in the present.

original: koṭyagraśaś ca sattvāntas tebhyas traikālyajo mataḥ // /
analyzed: koṭi agraśas ca sattva antaḥ tebhyaḥ traikālya jaḥ mataḥ
translated: And the end of beings is said to be in the triads of the three times.

original: vṛddhihetur na lokasya kṣayas traikālyasambhavaḥ /
analyzed: vṛddhi hetuḥ na lokasya kṣayaḥ traikālya sambhavaḥ
translated: The world's increase is not the cause, nor its decrease, which is possible in the three times.

original: sarvajñena kathaṃ tasya pūrvānto 'vyākṛtaḥ kṛtaḥ // /
analyzed: sarvajñena katham tasya pūrva antaḥ vyākṛtaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: How then did the Omniscient One make its beginning indeterminate?

original: etat tu dharmagāmbhīryaṃ yat tad guhyaṃ pṛthagjane /
analyzed: etat tu dharma gāmbhīryam yat tat guhyam pṛthagjane
translated: This, however, is the profundity of the Dharma, that which is hidden from ordinary people.

original: māyopamatvaṃ lokasya buddhānāṃ śāsanāmṛtaṃ // /
analyzed: māyā upama tvam lokasya buddhānām śāsana amṛtam
translated: The immortality of the Buddha's teaching is the world's resemblance to an illusion.

original: māyāgajasya dṛśyeta yathā janmānta eva ca /
analyzed: māyā gajasya dṛśyeta yathā janma antaḥ eva ca
translated: Just as the birth and end of an illusory elephant are seen,

original: na ca kaścit sa tattvena janmāntaś caiva vidyate // /
analyzed: na ca kaścid sa tattvena janma antaḥ ca eva vidyate
translated: but in reality neither its birth nor end exists.

original: māyopamasyalokasya tathā janmānta eva ca /
analyzed: māyā upamasya lokasya tathā janmāntaḥ eva ca
translated: In the same way, the birth and end of the world, which resembles an illusion,

original: dṛśyate paramārthena na ca janmānta eva ca // /
analyzed: dṛśyate parama arthena na ca janma antaḥ eva ca
translated: are seen in the ultimate sense, but neither its birth nor end exists.

original: yathā māyāgajo naiti kutaścid yāti na kvacit /
analyzed: yathā māyā gajaḥ na eti kutaścid yāti
translated: Just as an illusory elephant does not come from anywhere nor go anywhere,

original: cittamohanamātratvād bhāvatvena na tiṣṭhati // /
analyzed: citta mohana mātra tvāt bhāva tvena na tiṣṭhati
translated: because it is merely a deception of the mind, it does not exist as a real entity.

original: tathā māyopamo loko naiti yāti na kutracit /
analyzed: tathā māyā upamaḥ lokaḥ na eti yāti na kutracid
translated: In the same way, the world, which resembles an illusion, does not come from anywhere nor go anywhere,

original: cittamohanamātratvād bhāvatvena na tiṣṭhati // /
analyzed: citta mohana mātra tvāt bhāva tvena na tiṣṭhati
translated: because it is merely a deception of the mind, it does not exist as a real entity.

original: traikālyavyativṛttātmā loka evaṃ nu ko 'rthataḥ /
analyzed: traikālya vyativṛtta ātmā lokaḥ evam nu kaḥ ṛthataḥ
translated: In this way, the world, whose nature transcends the three times, does not exist in reality.

original: yo 'sti nāsty athavāpi syād anyatra vyavahārataḥ // /
analyzed: yaḥ u sti na asti athavā api syāt anyatra vyavahārataḥ
translated: It exists or does not exist, but only conventionally, not in reality.

original: catuṣprakāram ity asmāt sānto 'nanto dvayo 'dvayaḥ /
analyzed: catuṣprakāram iti asmāt sa antaḥ na ntaḥ dvayaḥ dvayaḥ
translated: The Buddha has declared this to be indeterminate,

original: buddhena hetor nānyasmād ayam avyākṛtaḥ kṛtaḥ // /
analyzed: buddhena hetoḥ na anyasmāt ayam avyākṛtaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: not for any other reason than the four kinds: with end, without end, both, and neither.

original: śarīrāśucitā tāvan sthūlā pratyakṣagocarā /
analyzed: śarīra aśucitā tāvat sthūlā pratyakṣa gocarā
translated: The impurity of the body is gross and within the range of perception,

original: satataṃ dṛśyamānāpi yadā citte na tiṣṭhati // /
analyzed: satatam dṛśyamānā api yadā citte na tiṣṭhati
translated: though always seen, it does not remain in the mind.

original: tadātisūkṣmo gambhīraḥ saddharmo 'yaṃ anālayaḥ /
analyzed: tadā ati sūkṣmaḥ gambhīraḥ saddharmaḥ yam an ālayaḥ
translated: Then this extremely subtle and profound true Dharma, without abode,

original: apratyakṣaḥ kathaṃ citte sukhenāvatariṣyati // /
analyzed: apratyakṣaḥ katham citte sukhena avatariṣyati
translated: how will it easily enter the mind, being imperceptible?

original: sambudhyāsmān nirvṛtto 'bhūd dharmaṃ deśayituṃ muniḥ /🔽durjñānam atigāmbhiryāj jñātvā dharmam imaṃ janaiḥ // /
analyzed: sambudhya asmān nirvṛttaḥ bhūt dharmam deśayitum muniḥ  durjñānam ati gāmbhiryāt jñātvā dharmam imam janaiḥ
translated: The Sage, having attained perfect enlightenment, became intent on teaching the Dharma,🔽knowing that this Dharma is difficult to understand by people due to its extreme profundity.

original: vināśayati durjñāto dharmo 'yam avipaścitaṃ /
analyzed: vināśayati durjñātaḥ dharmaḥ yam a vipaścitam
translated: This Dharma, if misunderstood, destroys the unwise,

original: nāstitādṛṣṭisamale yasmād asmin nimajjati // /
analyzed: nāstitā dṛṣṭi sa male yasmāt asmin nimajjati
translated: because he sinks in it, defiled by the view of non-existence.

original: aparo 'py asya durjñānān mūrkhaḥ paṇḍitamānikaḥ /🔽pratikṣepavinaṣṭātmā yāty avīcim adhomukhaḥ // /
analyzed: aparaḥ pi asya durjñānāt mūrkhaḥ paṇḍita mānikaḥ  pratikṣepa vinaṣṭa ātmā yāti avīcim adhomukhaḥ
translated: Another fool, conceited with the pride of knowledge, due to its difficulty of understanding,🔽goes to Avīci with his face down, his self destroyed by rejection.

original: durbhuktena yathānnena vināśam adhigacchati /
analyzed: durbhuktena yathā annena vināśam adhigacchati
translated: Just as by eating food improperly one comes to destruction,

original: subhuktenāyur ārogyaṃ balaṃ saukhyāni cāśnute // /
analyzed: su bhuktena āyuḥ ārogyam balam saukhyāni ca aśnute
translated: by eating properly one obtains long life, health, strength, and happiness.

original: durjñātena tathānena vināśam adhigacchati /
analyzed: durjñātena tathā anena vināśam adhigacchati
translated: By wrongly understanding it, one meets with destruction.

original: samyagjñātenātra sukhaṃ bodhiṃ cāpnoty anuttarāṃ // /
analyzed: samyak jñātena atra sukham bodhim ca āpnoti anuttarām
translated: By correctly understanding it here, one attains happiness and unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: tasmād atra pratikṣepaṃ dṛṣṭiṃ tyaktvā ca nāstikīṃ /
analyzed: tasmāt atra pratikṣepam dṛṣṭim tyaktvā ca nāstikīm
translated: Therefore, abandoning the view of rejection and disbelief in this,

original: saṃyagjñānaparaṃ yatnaṃ kuru sarvārthasiddhaye // /
analyzed: saṃyak jñāna param yatnam kuru a sarva artha siddhaye
translated: Strive properly for the sake of attaining all goals.

original: dharmasyāsyāparijñānād ahaṃkāro 'nuvartate /
analyzed: dharmasya asya aparijñānāt ahaṃkāraḥ nuvartate
translated: Due to the non-understanding of this Dharma, the sense of self continues.

original: tataḥ śubhāśubhaṃ karma tato janma śubhāśubhaṃ // /
analyzed: tatas śubha aśubham karma tatas janma śubha aśubham
translated: From that, good and bad actions, then good and bad birth.

original: tasmād yāvad avijñāto dharmo 'haṃkāraśātanaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt yāvat a vijñātaḥ dharmaḥ haṃkāra śātanaḥ
translated: Therefore, as long as the Dharma, which cuts off the sense of self, is not known,

original: dānaśīlakṣamādharme tāvad ādaravān bhava // /
analyzed: dāna śīla kṣamā dharme tāvat ādaravān bhava
translated: Be devoted to the Dharma of generosity, morality, and patience.

original: dharmapūrvāṇi kāryāṇi dharmamadhyāni pārthiva /
analyzed: dharma pūrvāṇi kāryāṇi dharma madhyāni pārthiva
translated: O King, all actions should be preceded by Dharma, have Dharma in the middle,

original: sādhayan dharmaniṣṭhāni neha nāmutra sīdati // /
analyzed: sādhayan dharma niṣṭhāni na iha na amutra sīdati
translated: Accomplishing them with Dharma as the ultimate, one does not perish in this world or the next.

original: dharmāt kīrtiḥ sukhaṃ caiva neha bhīr na mumūrṣataḥ /
analyzed: dharmāt kīrtiḥ sukham ca eva na iha bhīḥ na mumūrṣataḥ
translated: From Dharma comes fame and happiness, no fear in this world or at the time of death.

original: paralokasukhaṃ sphītaṃ tasmād dharmaṃ sadā bhaja // /🔽dharma eva parā nītir dharmāl loko 'nurajyate /
analyzed: para loka sukham sphītam tasmāt dharmam sadā bhaja  dharmaḥ eva parā nītiḥ dharmāt lokaḥ nurajyate
translated: Abundant happiness in the next world - therefore always rely on Dharma.🔽Dharma alone is the highest policy, the world is attracted to Dharma.

original: rañjitena hi lokena neha nāmutra vañcyate // /
analyzed: rañjitena hi lokena na iha na amutra vañcyate
translated: For one who is attracted by the world is not deceived in this world or the next.

original: adharmeṇa tu yā nītis tayā loko 'parajyate /
analyzed: adharmeṇa tu yā nītiḥ tayā parajyate
translated: But the world is won over by the policy that is based on unrighteousness.

original: lokāparañjanāc caiva neha nāmutra nandati // /
analyzed: loka aparañjanāt ca eva na iha na amutra nandati
translated: And because of winning over the world in this way, one does not rejoice either in this world or the next.

original: parātisandhānaparā kaṣṭā durgatipaddhatiḥ /
analyzed: para atisandhāna parā kaṣṭā durgati paddhatiḥ
translated: The path to bad destinies is difficult, devoted to harming others.

original: anarthavidyā duṣprajñair arthavidyā kathaṃ kṛtā // /
analyzed: anartha vidyā duṣprajñaiḥ artha vidyā katham kṛtā
translated: How was the knowledge of unrighteousness made into the knowledge of righteousness by those of bad wisdom?

original: parātisandhānaparo nītimān katham arthataḥ /
analyzed: para atisandhāna paraḥ nītimān katham arthataḥ
translated: How can one who is devoted to harming others be considered righteous in terms of policy?

original: yena janmasahasrāṇi bahūny ātmaiva vañcyate // /
analyzed: yena janma sahasrāṇi bahūni ātmā eva vañcyate
translated: By whom, for many thousands of births, is one's own self deceived?

original: ripor apriyam anvicchan dosāṃs tyaktvā guṇān śraya /
analyzed: ripoḥ apriyam anvicchan dosān tyaktvā guṇān śraya
translated: Seeking the misfortune of an enemy, abandoning faults, one should resort to virtues.

original: svahitāvāptir eva tu ripos cāpy apriyaṃ bhavet // /
analyzed: sva hita avāptiḥ eva tu ripoḥ ca api apriyam bhavet
translated: But the attainment of one's own welfare would be the misfortune of the enemy.

original: dānena priyavadyena hitenaikāthacaryayā /
analyzed: dānena priyavadyena hitena ekātha caryayā
translated: By generosity, by kind speech, by helpful action, and by being one in purpose,

original: ebhir ācara lokasya dharmasyaiva ca saṅgrahaṃ // /
analyzed: ebhiḥ ācara lokasya dharmasya eva ca saṅgraham
translated: by these, practice the gathering of both the world and Dharma.

original: viśvāsaṃ janayaty ekaṃ satyaṃ rājñāṃ yathā dṛḍhaṃ /
analyzed: viśvāsam janayati ekam satyam rājñām yathā dṛḍham
translated: Just as truth firmly generates trust in kings,

original: tathaivābhūtam apy eṣām aviśvāsakaraṃ paraṃ // /🔽nāvisaṃvādavat satyaṃ sattve odgataṃ arthataḥ /
analyzed: tathā eva abhūtam api eṣām aviśvāsa karam param  na avisaṃvādavat satyam sattve
translated: in the same way, this untruth is supremely distrustful for them.🔽Truth is not like non-deception, it is not superior in meaning in reality.

original: paraikāntahitaṃ satyam ahitatvān mṛṣetarat // /
analyzed: para ekānta hitam satyam ahita tvāt mṛṣā itarat
translated: Truth is solely beneficial to others, the opposite is false because it is not beneficial.

original: doṣān pracchādayaty ekas tyāgo rājñāṃ yathojjvalaḥ /
analyzed: doṣān pracchādayati ekaḥ tyāgaḥ rājñām yathā ujjvalaḥ
translated: One [king] conceals his faults, just as a blazing fire [conceals] the faults of kings.

original: tathā kārpaṇyam apy eṣāṃ guṇasarvasvaghātakaṃ // /
analyzed: tathā kārpaṇyam api eṣām guṇa sarvasva ghātakam
translated: In the same way, their miserliness destroys all their good qualities.

original: upaśāntasya gāmbhīryaṃ gāmbhīryād gauravaṃ paraṃ /
analyzed: upaśāntasya gāmbhīryam gāmbhīryāt gauravam param
translated: For one who is tranquil, there is dignity; from dignity, supreme respect;

original: gauravād dīptir ājñā ca tasmād upaśamaṃ bhaja // /
analyzed: gauravāt dīptiḥ ājñā ca tasmāt upaśamam bhaja
translated: from respect, radiance and command. Therefore, one should resort to tranquility.

original: ahāryabuddhiḥ prājñatvād aparapratyayaḥ sthiraḥ /
analyzed: a hārya buddhiḥ prājña tvāt apara pratyayaḥ sthiraḥ
translated: A king who is unshakable in his mind, wise, independent of others, and firm,

original: nātisandhīyate rājā tasmāt prajñāparo bhava // /
analyzed: na atisandhīyate rājā tasmāt prajñā paraḥ bhava
translated: is not easily swayed. Therefore, one should be devoted to wisdom.

original: satyatyāgaśamaprajño caturbhadro narādhipaḥ /
analyzed: caturbhadraḥ narādhipaḥ
translated: A king who possesses the four virtues of truth, generosity, tranquility, and wisdom,

original: dharmaś caturbhadra iva stūyate devamānuṣaiḥ // /🔽nigṛhyavādibhiḥ śuddhaiḥ prajñākāruṇyanirmalaiḥ /
analyzed: dharmaḥ catur bhadraḥ iva stūyate deva mānuṣaiḥ  nigṛhyavādibhiḥ śuddhaiḥ prajñā kāruṇya nirmalaiḥ
translated: is praised by gods and humans as if he were the Dharma with four virtues.🔽For one who always sits with pure and eloquent teachers, who are free from attachment and compassion,

original: sahāsīnasya satataṃ prajñā dharmaś ca varddhate // /
analyzed: saha āsīnasya satatam prajñā dharmaḥ ca varddhate
translated: wisdom and Dharma always increase.

original: durlabhāḥ pathyavaktāraḥ śrotāras tv atidurlabhāḥ /
analyzed: durlabhāḥ pathya vaktāraḥ śrotāraḥ tu ati durlabhāḥ
translated: Those who speak wholesome words are rare, but those who listen are even rarer.

original: tebhyo 'tidurlabhatamā ye pathyasyāśu kāriṇaḥ // /🔽pathyam apy apriyaṃ tasmāj jñātvā śīghraṃ samācara /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ ti durlabhatamāḥ ye pathyasya āśu kāriṇaḥ  pathyam api apriyam tasmāt jñātvā śīghram samācara
translated: Even rarer than they are those who quickly act on wholesome advice.🔽Therefore, one should quickly act on even unpleasant wholesome advice.

original: pibed auṣadham apy ugram ārogyāyātmavān iva // /
analyzed: pibet auṣadham api ugram ārogyāya ātmavān iva
translated: One should drink even bitter medicine, if one is self-possessed for the sake of health.

original: jīvitārogyarājyānāṃ cintayānityatāṃ sadā /
analyzed: jīvita ārogya rājyānām cintaya anitya tām sadā
translated: Always think of the impermanence of life, health, and kingdom.

original: tataḥ saṃvegavān dharmam ekāntena prayāsyase // /
analyzed: tatas saṃvegavān dharmam ekāntena prayāsyase
translated: Then, full of urgency, you will go solely to the Dharma.

original: avaśyaṃ maraṇaṃ paśyan pāpād duḥkhaṃ mṛtasya ca /
analyzed: avaśyam maraṇam paśyan pāpāt duḥkham mṛtasya ca
translated: Seeing that death is certain, and that after death there is suffering from evil,

original: aihikena sukhenāpi na pāpaṃ kṣātum arhasi // /
analyzed: aihikena sukhena api na pāpam kṣātum arhasi
translated: you should not commit evil even for the sake of present happiness.

original: kasmiṃś ced abhayaṃ dṛṣṭaṃ bhayaṃ dṛṣṭaṃ kvacit kṣaṇe /
analyzed: kasmin ced abhayam dṛṣṭam bhayam dṛṣṭam kvacid kṣaṇe
translated: If safety is seen in one place, and danger is seen in another place,

original: yady ekasmin samāśvāsaḥ kim ekasmin na te bhayaṃ // /
analyzed: yadi ekasmin samāśvāsaḥ kim ekasmin na te bhayam
translated: if you have confidence in one, why do you not fear in the other?

original: madyāt paribhavo loke kāryahānir dhanakṣayaḥ /
analyzed: madyāt paribhavaḥ loke kārya hāniḥ dhana kṣayaḥ
translated: From alcohol comes contempt in the world, loss of work, loss of wealth,

original: akāryakāraṇam mohāt madyam tyaja tataḥ sadā // /
analyzed: akārya kāraṇam mohāt madyam tyaja tatas sadā
translated: and doing what should not be done out of delusion. Always give up alcohol.
